That's great that you're committed to improving your game! Taking lessons from a qualified coach can definitely help you improve your overall game, including your backhand slice. Here are some ways a coach can benefit your game:

**Personalized feedback**: A coach can provide personalized feedback on your technique, identifying areas for improvement and helping you develop a more efficient and effective swing.

**Customized instruction**: A coach can tailor their instruction to your specific needs and goals, whether it's improving your backhand slice, serving, or overall game strategy.

**Improved technique**: A coach can help you develop proper technique, which can lead to more consistent and powerful shots, as well as reduced risk of injury.

**Game strategy and tactics**: A coach can help you develop a better understanding of the game, including how to read your opponents, anticipate their shots, and make smart decisions on the court.

**Practice planning and accountability**: A coach can help you develop a practice plan that targets your weaknesses and helps you stay focused and motivated.

**Mental toughness and confidence**: A coach can help you develop mental toughness and confidence, which are essential for performing at your best in competitive matches like your Thursday doubles league.

**Video analysis**: Many coaches use video analysis to review your game, providing a more objective view of your technique and helping you identify areas for improvement.

**Drills and exercises**: A coach can provide you with specific drills and exercises to help you improve your footwork, agility, strength, and endurance.

**Support and motivation**: A coach can offer encouragement and support, helping you stay motivated and committed to your goals.

Before committing to lessons, consider the following:

**Set specific goals**: Identify what you want to achieve through lessons, whether it's improving your backhand slice, increasing your serving speed, or reducing your error rate.

**Find a coach who fits your style**: Look for a coach who has experience teaching players at your level and has a teaching style that resonates with you.

**Be patient and persistent**: Improvement takes time and effort, so be patient and committed to the process.

I hope this helps, and I'm sure you'll see improvement in your game with the help of a qualified coach!
